P4para.Text: the mental health officer;
the offenders responsible medical officer; or

any person responsible for providing medical treatment, community care services, relevant services or any treatment, care or service to the offender who is authorised for the purposes of this paragraph by the offenders responsible medical officer,

P3para.Text: to visit the offender in the place where the offender resides;
the imposition of a requirement on the offender to obtain the approval of the mental health officer to any change of address; and
the imposition of a requirement on the offender to inform the mental health officer of any change of address before the change takes effect.

P2para.Text: The court may make a compulsion order imposing, by virtue of subsection (8)(e) above, a requirement on an offender to reside at a specified place which is a place used for the purpose of providing a care home service only if the court is satisfied that the person providing the care home service is willing to receive the offender.

The Scottish Ministers may, by regulations made by statutory instrument, make provision for measures prescribed by the regulations to be treated as included among the measures mentioned in subsection (8) above.
The power conferred by subsection (10) above may be exercised so as to make different provision for different cases or descriptions of case or for different purposes.
No regulations shall be made under subsection (10) above unless a draft of the statutory instrument containing them has been laid before, and approved by a resolution of, the Scottish Parliament.

The court shall be satisfied as to the condition mentioned in subsection (3)(a) above only if the description of the offenders mental disorder by each of the medical practitioners mentioned in subsection (2)(a) above specifies, by reference to the appropriate paragraph (or paragraphs) of the definition of mental disorder in section 328(1) of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment)
(Scotland) Act 2003 (asp 13), at least one type of mental disorder that the offender has that is also specified by the other.
A compulsion order

P3para.Text: shall specify

P4para.Text:
by reference to the appropriate paragraph (or paragraphs) of the definition of mental disorder in section 328(1) of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment)
(Scotland) Act 2003 (asp 13), the type (or types) of mental disorder that each of the medical practitioners mentioned in subsection (2)(a) above specifies that the offender has that is also specified by the other; and

if the order does not, by virtue of subsection (8)(a) above, authorise the detention of the offender in hospital, the name of the hospital the managers of which are to have responsibility for appointing the offenders responsible medical officer; and

P3para.Text: may include

P4para.Text: in a case where a compulsion order authorises the detention of the offender in a specified hospital by virtue of subsection (8)(a) above; or
in a case where a compulsion order imposes a requirement on the offender to reside at a specified place by virtue of subsection (8)(e) above,

P3para.Text: such directions as the court thinks fit for the removal of the offender to, and the detention of the offender in, a place of safety pending the offenders admission to the specified hospital or, as the case may be, place.

P2para.Text: Where the court makes a compulsion order in relation to an offender, the court

P3para.Text: shall not

P4para.Text: make an order under section 200 of this Act;
make an interim compulsion order;
make a guardianship order;
pass a sentence of imprisonment;
impose a fine;
make a probation order; or
make a community service order,

P3para.Text: in relation to the offender;
may make any other order that the court has power to make apart from this section.

P2para.Text: In this section

Para.Text: care home service has the meaning given by section 2(3) of the Regulation of Care (Scotland) Act 2001 (asp 8);
community care services has the meaning given by section 5A(4) of the Social Work (Scotland) Act 1968 (c. 49);
medical treatment has the same meaning as in section 52D of this Act;
relevant services has the meaning given by section 19(2) of the Children (Scotland) Act 1995 (c. 36);

responsible medical officer, in relation to an offender, means the responsible medical officer appointed in respect of the offender under section 230 of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment)
(Scotland) Act 2003 (asp 13);
restriction order means an order under section 59 of this Act;
sentence of imprisonment includes any sentence or order for detention; and
specified means specified in the compulsion order.

P1group.Title: Compulsion order authorising detention in hospital or requiring residence at place: ancillary provision

P2para.Text: Where a compulsion order

P3para.Text: authorises the detention of an offender in a specified hospital; or
imposes a requirement on an offender to reside at a specified place,

P2para.Text: this section authorises the removal, before the expiry of the period of 7 days beginning with the day on which the order is made, of the offender to the specified hospital or place, by any of the persons mentioned in subsection (2) below.
Those persons are

P3para.Text: a constable;

a person employed in, or contracted to provide services in or to, the specified hospital who is authorised by the managers of that hospital to remove persons to hospital for the purposes of this section; and
a specified person.

P2para.Text: In this section, specified means specified in the compulsion order.

P1group.Title: Mental health officers report

P2para.Text: This section applies where the court is considering making a compulsion order in relation to an offender under section 57A of this Act.
If directed to do so by the court, the mental health officer shall

P3para.Text: subject to subsection (3) below, interview the offender; and
prepare a report in relation to the offender in accordance with subsection (4) below.

P2para.Text: If it is impracticable for the mental health officer to comply with the requirement in subsection (2)(a) above, the mental health officer need not do so.
The report shall state

P3para.Text: the name and address of the offender;
if known by the mental health officer, the name and address of the offenders primary carer;
in so far as relevant for the purposes of section 57A of this Act, details of the personal circumstances of the offender; and
any other information that the mental health officer considers relevant for the purposes of that section.

P2para.Text: In this section

Para.Text:
carer, and primary, in relation to a carer, have the meanings given by section 329(1) of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment)
(Scotland) Act 2003 (asp 13);
mental health officer means a person appointed (or deemed to be appointed) under section 32(1) of that Act; and
named person has the meaning given by section 329(1) of that Act.

P1group.Title: Compulsion order: supplementary

P2para.Text: If, before the expiry of the period of 7 days beginning with the day on which a compulsion order authorising detention of the offender in a hospital is made, it appears to the court, or, as the case may be, the Scottish Ministers, that, by reason of emergency or other special circumstances, it is not reasonably practicable for the offender to be admitted to the hospital specified in the order, the court, or, as the case may be, the Scottish Ministers, may direct that the offender be admitted to the hospital specified in the direction.
Where

P3para.Text: the court makes a direction under subsection (1) above, it shall inform the person having custody of the offender; and
the Scottish Ministers make such a direction, they shall inform

P4para.Text: the court; and
the person having custody of the offender.

P2para.Text: Where a direction is made under subsection (1) above, the compulsion order shall have effect as if the hospital specified in the direction were the hospital specified in the order.
In this section, court means the court which made the compulsion order.

P1group.Title: Power of court to detain acquitted persons

P1para.Text: After section 60B of the 1995 Act, there shall be inserted

P1group.Title: Acquitted persons: detention for medical examination

P2para.Text: Subject to subsection (7) below, this section applies where a person charged with an offence is acquitted.
If the court by or before which the person is acquitted is satisfied

P3para.Text: on the written or oral evidence of two medical practitioners that the conditions mentioned in subsection (3) below are met in respect of the person; and
that it is not practicable to secure the immediate examination of the person by a medical practitioner,

P2para.Text: the court may, immediately after the person is acquitted, make an order authorising the measures mentioned in subsection (4) below for the purpose of enabling arrangements to be made for a medical practitioner to carry out a medical examination of the person.
The conditions referred to in subsection (2)(a) above are

P3para.Text: that the person has a mental disorder;
that medical treatment which would be likely to

P4para.Text: prevent the mental disorder worsening; or
alleviate any of the symptoms, or effects, of the disorder,

P3para.Text: is available for the person; and
that if the person were not provided with such medical treatment there would be a significant risk

P4para.Text: to the health, safety or welfare of the person; or
to the safety of any other person.

P2para.Text: The measures referred to in subsection (2) above are

P3para.Text: the removal of the person to a place of safety by

P4para.Text: a constable; or
a person specified by the court; and

P3para.Text: the detention, subject to subsection (6) below, of the person in that place of safety for a period of 6 hours beginning with the time at which the order under subsection (2) above is made.

P2para.Text: If the person absconds

P3para.Text: while being removed to a place of safety under subsection (4) above; or
from the place of safety,

P2para.Text: a constable or the person specified by the court under paragraph (a) of that subsection may, at any time during the period mentioned in paragraph (b) of that subsection, take the person into custody and remove the person to a place of safety.
An order under this section ceases to authorise detention of a person if, following the medical examination of the person, a medical practitioner grants

P3para.Text:
an emergency detention certificate under section 36 of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment)
(Scotland) Act 2003 (asp 13); or
a short-term detention certificate under section 44 of that Act.

P2para.Text: This section does not apply

P3para.Text: in a case where a declaration is made by virtue of section 54(6) of this Act that the person is acquitted on account of the persons insanity at the time of doing the act or making the omission constituting the offence with which the person was charged; or
in a case where the court states under section 55(4) of this Act that the person is so acquitted on the ground of such insanity.

P2para.Text: In this section, medical treatment has the same meaning as in section 52D of this Act.

P1group.Title: Notification of detention under section 60C

P2para.Text: This section applies where a person has been removed to a place of safety under section 60C of this Act.

The court shall, before the expiry of the period of 14 days beginning with the day on which the order under section 60C(2) of this Act is made, ensure that the Mental Welfare Commission is given notice of the matters mentioned in subsection (3) below.
Those matters are

P3para.Text: the name and address of the person removed to the place of safety;
the date on and time at which the person was so removed;
the address of the place of safety;
if the person is removed to a police station, the reason why the person was removed there; and
any other matter that the Scottish Ministers may, by regulations made by statutory instrument, prescribe.

P2para.Text: The power conferred by subsection (3)(e) above may be exercised so as to make different provision for different cases or descriptions of case or for different purposes.
A statutory instrument containing regulations under subsection (3)(e) above shall be subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the Scottish Parliament.

Title.Emphasis: Probation with a requirement of treatment

P1group.Title: Amendment of 1995 Act: probation for treatment of mental disorder
Transfer of prisoners for treatment for mental disorder

P2para.Text: This section applies where a person (in this section referred to as the prisoner) is serving a sentence of imprisonment.

If the Scottish Ministers are satisfied, on the written reports of an approved medical practitioner and a medical practitioner as to the matters mentioned in subsection (3) below, they may, subject to subsection (5) below, make a direction (referred to in this Act as a transfer for treatment direction) authorising the measures mentioned in subsection (6) below.
The matters referred to in subsection (2) above are

P3para.Text: that the conditions mentioned in subsection (4) below are met in respect of the prisoner;

Text.Addition: that
a mental health officer has agreed to the making of the direction, or
it has been impracticable to obtain the agreement of a mental health officer;

P3para.Text: that the prisoner could be admitted to the hospital to be specified in the direction before the expiry of the period of 7 days beginning with the day on which the direction is made; and
that the hospital to be so specified is suitable for the purpose of giving medical treatment to the prisoner.

P2para.Text: The conditions referred to in subsection (3)(a) above are

P3para.Text: that the prisoner has a mental disorder;
that medical treatment which would be likely to

P4para.Text: prevent the mental disorder worsening; or
alleviate any of the symptoms, or effects, of the disorder,

P3para.Text: is available for the prisoner;
that if the prisoner were not provided with such medical treatment there would be a significant risk

P4para.Text: to the health, safety or welfare of the prisoner; or
to the safety of any other person; and

P3para.Text: that the making of a transfer for treatment direction in respect of the prisoner is necessary.

P2para.Text: A transfer for treatment direction may authorise detention in a state hospital only if, on the written reports of the approved medical practitioner and the medical practitioner mentioned in subsection (2) above, it appears to the Scottish Ministers

P3para.Text: that the prisoner requires to be detained in hospital under conditions of special security; and
that such conditions of special security can be provided only in a state hospital.

P2para.Text: The measures are

P3para.Text: the removal, before the expiry of the period of 7 days beginning with the day on which the direction is made, of the prisoner to the specified hospital by

P4para.Text: a constable;

a person employed in, or contracted to provide services in or to, the specified hospital who is authorised by the managers of that hospital to remove persons to hospital for the purposes of this section; or
a specified person;

P3para.Text: the detention of the prisoner in the specified hospital; and
the giving to the prisoner, in accordance with Part 16 of this Act, of medical treatment.

P2para.Text: The Scottish Ministers shall be satisfied as to the condition mentioned in subsection (4)(a) above only if the descriptions of the prisoners mental disorder by each of the medical practitioners mentioned in subsection (2) above specifies, by reference to the appropriate paragraph (or paragraphs) of the definition of mental disorder in section 328(1) of this Act, at least one type of mental disorder that the prisoner has that is also specified by the other.
A transfer for treatment direction

P3para.Text: shall specify, by reference to the appropriate paragraph (or paragraphs) of the definition of mental disorder in section 328(1) of this Act, the type (or types) of mental disorder that each of the medical practitioners mentioned in subsection (2) above specifies that the prisoner has that is also specified by the other; and

may include such directions as the Scottish Ministers think fit for the removal of the prisoner to, and the detention of the prisoner in, a place of safety pending the prisoners admission to the specified hospital.

P2para.Text: In subsection (1) above, the reference to a prisoner serving a sentence of imprisonment includes a reference

P3para.Text: to a prisoner detained in pursuance of any sentence or order for detention made by a court (other than an order under section 52D(2), 52M(2), 53(2), 54, 57(2), 57A(2), 118(5) or 190 of the 1995 Act); and
to a prisoner committed by a court to prison in default of payment of any fine to be paid on the prisoners conviction.

P2para.Text: In this section

Para.Text: place of safety has the same meaning as in section 300 of this Act; and
specified means specified in the transfer for treatment direction.

Text.Addition: A reference in this section to a hospital may be read as a reference to a hospital unit.
For the purpose of subsection (11) above,
means any part of a hospital which is treated as a separate unit.

P1group.Title: Part 9 care plan

P2para.Text: This section applies where a compulsion order authorising the measures specified in it for the period mentioned in section 57A(2) of the 1995 Act (any such compulsion order being referred to in this Part of this Act as a relevant compulsion order) is made in respect of a patient.
As soon as practicable after a patients responsible medical officer is appointed under section 230 of this Act the responsible medical officer shall

P3para.Text: prepare a plan (any such plan being referred to in this Part of this Act as a Part 9 care plan) relating to the patient; and
ensure that the patients Part 9 care plan is included in the patients medical records.

P2para.Text: The Part 9 care plan shall record

P3para.Text: the medical treatment

P4para.Text: which it is proposed to give; and
which is being given,

P3para.Text: to the patient while the patient is subject to the compulsion order; and
such other information relating to the care of the patient as may be prescribed by regulations.

P2para.Text: Subject to subsection (5)(b) below, a patients responsible medical officer may from time to time amend the patients Part 9 care plan.
Regulations may prescribe

P3para.Text: circumstances in which a patients responsible medical officer is required to amend the patients Part 9 care plan;
information in a Part 9 care plan which may not be amended.

P2para.Text: Where a patients responsible medical officer amends the patients Part 9 care plan

P3para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall secure that, as soon as practicable after it is amended, the amended Part 9 care plan is included in the patients medical records; and
subsections (3) to (5) above and this subsection shall apply as if references to the Part 9 care plan were references to the amended Part 9 care plan.

P1group.Title: Mental health officers duty to identify named person

P1para.Text: The mental health officer shall, as soon as practicable after a relevant compulsion order is made in respect of the patient, take such steps as are reasonably practicable to ascertain the name and address of the patients named person.

Title.Emphasis: Mandatory reviews by responsible medical officer

P1group.Title: First review of compulsion order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a relevant compulsion order is made in respect of a patient.

The patients responsible medical officer shall, during the appropriate period, carry out a review in respect of the compulsion order (such review being referred to in this Part of this Act as the first review) by complying with the requirements in subsection (3) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: to

P4para.Text: carry out a medical examination of the patient; or
make arrangements for an approved medical practitioner to carry out such a medical examination;

P3para.Text: to consider

P4para.Text: whether the conditions mentioned in subsection (4) below continue to apply in respect of the patient; and
whether it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order; and

P3para.Text: to consult

P4para.Text: the mental health officer;
such persons as are mentioned in subsection (5) below as the responsible medical officer considers appropriate; and
such other persons as the responsible medical officer considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: Those conditions are

P3para.Text: that the patient has a mental disorder;
that medical treatment which would be likely to

P4para.Text: prevent the mental disorder worsening; or
alleviate any of the symptoms, or effects, of the disorder,

P3para.Text: is available for the patient; and
that if the patient were not provided with such medical treatment there would be a significant risk

P4para.Text: to the health, safety or welfare of the patient; or
to the safety of any other person.

P2para.Text: The persons referred to in subsection (3)(c)(ii) above are

P3para.Text: persons who appear to the responsible medical officer to provide medical treatment of the kind that is recorded in the Part 9 care plan;
if any community care services or relevant services are set out in that plan, persons who appear to the responsible medical officer to provide services of that kind;
if any other treatment, care or service is set out in that plan, persons who appear to the responsible medical officer to provide treatment, care or a service of that kind.

P2para.Text: In subsection (2) above, appropriate period means the period of 2 months ending with the day on which the relevant compulsion order ceases to authorise the measures specified in it.

P1group.Title: Further reviews of compulsion order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a relevant compulsion order is extended by virtue of an order under section 167 of this Act.

The patients responsible medical officer shall, during the period mentioned in subsection (3) below, carry out a review in respect of the compulsion order (such review being referred to in this Part of this Act as a further review) by complying with the requirements in section 139(3) of this Act.

The period referred to in subsection (2) above is the period of 2 months ending with the day on which the compulsion order, as extended by virtue of the order, ceases to authorise the measures specified in it.

Title.Emphasis: Revocation of order by responsible medical officer or Commission

P1group.Title: Responsible medical officers duty to revoke compulsion order: mandatory reviews

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer is carrying out

P3para.Text: the first review of the relevant compulsion order to which the patient is subject; or
a further review of that order.

P2para.Text: If, having regard to any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act for the purpose of the review being carried out, the responsible medical officer is not satisfied

P3para.Text: that the conditions mentioned in section 139(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; or
that it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall make a determination revoking the compulsion order.
A determination under this section shall be made as soon as practicable after the duty to make it arises.

P1group.Title: Revocation of compulsion order: responsible medical officers duty to keep under review

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patient is subject to a relevant compulsion order.

Without prejudice to the duties imposed on the patients responsible medical officer by sections 139(2), 140(2), 141(2) and 159(2) of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall from time to time consider

P3para.Text: whether the conditions mentioned in section 139(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; and
whether it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order.

P2para.Text: If, having considered the matters mentioned in paragraphs (a) and (b) of subsection (2) above, the responsible medical officer is not satisfied

P3para.Text: that the conditions mentioned in section 139(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; or
that it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall make a determination revoking the compulsion order.

P1group.Title: Commissions power to revoke compulsion order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patient is subject to a relevant compulsion order.
If the Commission is satisfied

P3para.Text: that not all of the conditions mentioned in section 139(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; or
that it does not continue to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order,

P2para.Text: it may make a determination revoking the compulsion order.

P1group.Title: Revocation of compulsion order: notification

P2para.Text: Where a patients responsible medical officer makes a determination under section 141 or 142 of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall

P3para.Text: give notice of the determination; and
send a statement of the reasons for it,

P2para.Text: to the Commission and to the persons mentioned in subsection (3) below.
Where the Commission makes a determination under section 143 of this Act it shall

P3para.Text: give notice of the determination; and
send a statement of the reasons for it,

P2para.Text: to the patients responsible medical officer and to the persons mentioned in subsection (3) below.
The persons referred to in subsections (1) and (2) above are

P3para.Text: the patient;
the patients named person;
any guardian of the patient;
any welfare attorney of the patient;
the mental health officer; and
the Tribunal.

P2para.Text: Notice under subsection (1) or (2) above

P3para.Text: to the persons mentioned in subsection (3)(a) to (d) above shall be given as soon as practicable after the determination is made and, in any event, before the expiry of the period of 7 days beginning with the day on which the determination is made; and
to

P4para.Text: the Commission;
the patients responsible medical officer; and
the persons mentioned in subsection (3)(e) and (f) above,

P3para.Text: shall be given before the expiry of the period of 7 days beginning with the day on which the determination is made.

Title.Emphasis: Further steps to be taken where order not revoked

P1group.Title: Mandatory reviews: further steps to be taken where compulsion order not revoked

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer is carrying out

P3para.Text: the first review of the relevant compulsion order to which the patient is subject; or
a further review of that order.

P2para.Text: If, having regard to any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act for the purpose of the review being carried out, the patients responsible medical officer is satisfied

P3para.Text: that the conditions mentioned in section 139(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; and
that it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall comply with the requirements in subsection (3) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: to consider whether it will continue to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order after the day on which the order to which the patient is subject will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it;
to assess the needs of the patient for medical treatment;
to consider

P4para.Text: whether the compulsion order should be varied by modifying the measures specified in it;
if the order should be varied, what modification is appropriate; and

P3para.Text: to consider any views expressed on the matters mentioned in paragraphs (a) to (c) above by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act.

Title.Emphasis: Extension of order following first review

P1group.Title: First review: responsible medical officers duty where extension proposed

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer is carrying out the first review of the relevant compulsion order to which the patient is subject.
If, having regard to any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act, it appears to the responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: that it will continue to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order after the day on which the order will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it; and
that the compulsion order should not be varied by modifying the measures specified in it,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall give notice to the mental health officer that the responsible medical officer is proposing to make an application under section 149 of this Act for an order under section 167 extending the compulsion order for the period of 6 months beginning with the day on which the compulsion order will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it.

P1group.Title: Proposed extension on first review: mental health officers duties

P2para.Text: The mental health officer shall, as soon as practicable after receiving notice under section 146(2) of this Act, comply with the requirements in subsection (2) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: subject to subsection (3) below, to interview the patient;
to inform the patient

P4para.Text: that the patients responsible medical officer is proposing to make an application under section 149 of this Act for an order under section 167 of this Act;
of the patients rights in relation to such an application; and
of the availability of independent advocacy services under section 259 of this Act;

P3para.Text: to take appropriate steps to ensure that the patient has the opportunity of making use of those services; and
to inform the patients responsible medical officer

P4para.Text: as to whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees, that the proposed application should be made;
if the mental health officer disagrees, of the reason why that is the case; and
of any other matters that the mental health officer considers relevant.

P2para.Text: If it is impracticable for the mental health officer to comply with the requirement in subsection (2)(a) above, the mental health officer need not do so.

P1group.Title: First review: responsible medical officers duty to apply for extension of compulsion order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer is carrying out the first review of the relevant compulsion order to which the patient is subject.
If, having regard to

P3para.Text: any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act; and
any views expressed by the mental health officer under section 147(2)(d) of this Act,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer is satisfied as to the matters mentioned in section 146(2)(a) and (b) of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall comply with the requirement mentioned in subsection (3) below.

The requirement referred to in subsection (2) above is to make an application to the Tribunal under section 149 of this Act for an order extending the compulsion order for the period of 6 months beginning with the day on which the order to which the patient is subject will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it.

P1group.Title: Application to Tribunal for extension of order following first review

P1para.Text: An application under this section to the Tribunal by a patients responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: shall state

P4para.Text: the name and address of the patient;
the name and address of the patients named person; and
whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees, that the application should be made, or has failed to comply with the duty imposed by section 147(2)(d)(i) of this Act; and

P3para.Text: shall be accompanied by such documents as may be prescribed by regulations.

Title.Emphasis: Extension of order following further review

P1group.Title: Further review: responsible medical officers duty where extension proposed

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer is carrying out a further review of the relevant compulsion order to which the patient is subject.
If, having regard to any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act for the purpose of the review being carried out, it appears to the responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: that it will continue to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order after the day on which the order will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it; and
that the compulsion order should not be varied by modifying the measures specified in it,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall give notice to the mental health officer that the responsible medical officer is proposing to make a determination under section 152 of this Act extending the order.

P1group.Title: Proposed extension of order on further review: mental health officers duties

P2para.Text: The mental health officer shall, as soon as practicable after receiving notice under section 150(2) of this Act, comply with the requirements in subsection (2) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: subject to subsection (3) below, to interview the patient;
to inform the patient

P4para.Text: that the patients responsible medical officer is proposing to make a determination under section 152 of this Act extending the compulsion order to which the patient is subject for the period mentioned in section 152(3) of this Act that applies in the patients case;
of the patients rights in relation to such a determination; and
of the availability of independent advocacy services under section 259 of this Act;

P3para.Text: to take appropriate steps to ensure that the patient has the opportunity of making use of those services; and
to inform the patients responsible medical officer

P4para.Text: as to whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees, that the determination that is proposed should be made;
if the mental health officer disagrees, of the reason why that is the case; and
of any other matters that the mental health officer considers relevant.

P2para.Text: If it is impracticable for the mental health officer to comply with the requirement in subsection (2)(a) above, the mental health officer need not do so.

P1group.Title: Further review: responsible medical officers duty to extend compulsion order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer is carrying out a further review of the relevant compulsion order to which the patient is subject.
If, having regard to

P3para.Text: any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act for the purpose of the review being carried out; and
any views expressed by the mental health officer under section 151(2)(d) of this Act for the purpose of that review,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer is satisfied as to the matters mentioned in section 150(2)(a) and (b) of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall make a determination extending the compulsion order for the period mentioned in subsection (3) below.
The period referred to in subsection (2) above is

P3para.Text: where a determination is made in respect of the first further review, the period of 12 months beginning with the expiry of the period for which the order is extended by virtue of an order under section 167 of this Act;

where a determination is made in respect of a subsequent further review, the period of 12 months beginning with the expiry of the period of 12 months for which the order is extended as a result of the immediately preceding further review.

P1group.Title: Determination extending compulsion order: notification

P2para.Text: Where a patients responsible medical officer makes a determination under section 152 of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall, as soon as practicable after the determination is made and, in any event, before the day on which the compulsion order will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it, comply with the requirements in subsection (2) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: to prepare a record stating

P4para.Text: the determination;
the reasons for it;
whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees, with the determination or has failed to comply with the duty imposed by section 151(2)(d)(i) of this Act;
if the mental health officer disagrees with the determination, the reasons for the disagreement;

(by reference to the appropriate paragraph (or paragraphs) of the definition of mental disorder in section 328(1) of this Act) the type (or types) of mental disorder that the patient has; and if there is a difference between that type (or types) and the type (or types) of mental disorder recorded in the compulsion order in respect of which the determination is made, what that difference is; and
such other matters as may be prescribed by regulations;

P3para.Text: to submit the record to the Tribunal; and
at the same time as the responsible medical officer submits the record to the Tribunal, to give notice of the determination and send a copy of the record

P4para.Text: subject to subsection (3) below, to the patient;
to the patients named person;
to the mental health officer; and
to the Commission.

P2para.Text: Where the responsible medical officer considers that there would be a risk of significant harm to the patient, or to others, if a copy of the record were sent to the patient, that officer need not send a copy to the patient.

At the same time as the responsible medical officer submits the record to the Tribunal the responsible medical officer shall send to the Tribunal, and to the persons mentioned in subsection (2)(c)(ii) to (iv) above, a statement of the matters mentioned in subsection (5) below.
Those matters are

P3para.Text: whether the responsible medical officer is sending a copy of the record to the patient; and
if the responsible medical officer is not sending a copy of the record to the patient, the reason for not doing so.

Title.Addition: Further information on extension of compulsion order

Text.Addition: Subsections (2) and (3) below apply where
a mental health officer receives notice of a determination under section 152 of this Act from a patient's responsible medical officer, and
the Tribunal is required by virtue of section 165(2)(a) of this Act to review the determination.
The mental health officer must
prepare a record stating the information mentioned in subsection (4) below,
submit the record to the Tribunal, and
at the same time as submitting the record to the Tribunal, send to the persons mentioned in subsection (6) below
a copy of the record, and
a statement of the matters mentioned in subsection (5) below.

At the same time as submitting the record to the Tribunal, the mental health officer must send a copy of the record to the patient except where the officer considers that doing so carries a risk of significant harm to the patient or others.
The information to be stated in the record is
the name and address of the patient,
if known by the mental health officer, the name and address of
the patient's named person, and
the patient's primary carer,

the things done by the mental health officer in compliance with the requirements in subsection (2) of section 151 of this Act (and, if by virtue of subsection (3) of that section the first-listed one has not been complied with, the reason why compliance with it was impracticable),
so far as relevant to the extension of the compulsion order
the details of the personal circumstances of the patient, and
if known by the mental health officer, the details of any advance statement made by the patient (and not withdrawn by the patient),
the views of the mental health officer on the extension of the compulsion order, and
any other information that the mental health officer considers relevant in relation to the extension of the compulsion order.
The matters referred to in subsection (2)(c) above are
whether the mental health officer is sending a copy of the record to the patient, and
if the mental health officer is not sending a copy of the record to the patient, the reason for not doing so.
For the purposes of subsection (2)(c) above, the persons are
the patient's named person,
the patient's responsible medical officer, and
the Commission.

P1group.Title: Responsible medical officers duty where extension and variation proposed

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer is carrying out

P3para.Text: the first review of the relevant compulsion order to which the patient is subject; or
a further review of that order.

P2para.Text: If, having regard to any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act for the purpose of the review being carried out, it appears to the responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: that it will continue to be necessary for the patient to be subject to a compulsion order after the day on which the order will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it; but
that the compulsion order should be varied by modifying the measures specified in it,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall comply with the requirement in subsection (3) below.
The requirement is to give notice to the mental health officer

P3para.Text: that the responsible medical officer is proposing to make an application to the Tribunal under section 158 of this Act for an order under section 167 of this Act

P4para.Text: extending the compulsion order for the period mentioned in subsection (4) below; and
varying the order by modifying the measures specified in it; and

P3para.Text: of the modification of the measures specified in that order that the responsible medical officer is proposing.

P2para.Text: The period referred to in subsection (3)(a)(i) above is

P3para.Text: where the application is made in respect of the first review, the period of 6 months beginning with the day on which the compulsion order will cease (unless extended) to authorise the measures specified in it;
where the application is made in respect of the first further review, the period of 12 months beginning with the expiry of the period mentioned in paragraph (a) above;

where the application is made in respect of a subsequent further review, the period of 12 months beginning with the expiry of the period of 12 months for which the order is extended as a result of the immediately preceding further review.

P1group.Title: Mental health officers duties: extension and variation of compulsion order

P2para.Text: The mental health officer shall, as soon as practicable after receiving notice under section 154(3) of this Act, comply with the requirements in subsection (2) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: subject to subsection (3) below, to interview the patient;
to inform the patient of the matters mentioned in subsection (4) below;
to inform the patient of the availability of independent advocacy services under section 259 of this Act;
to take appropriate steps to ensure that the patient has the opportunity of making use of those services; and
to inform the patients responsible medical officer

P4para.Text: of whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees, that the application that is proposed should be made;
if the mental health officer disagrees, of the reason why that is the case; and
of any other matters that the mental health officer considers relevant.

P2para.Text: If it is impracticable for the mental health officer to comply with the requirement in subsection (2)(a) above, the mental health officer need not do so.
The matters referred to in subsection (2)(b) above are

P3para.Text: that the patients responsible medical officer is proposing to make an application to the Tribunal under section 158 of this Act for an order

P4para.Text: extending the compulsion order to which the patient is subject for the period mentioned in section 154(4) of this Act that applies in the patients case; and
varying the compulsion order by modifying the measures specified in it;

P3para.Text: the modification of the measures specified in that order that the responsible medical officer is proposing; and
the patients rights in relation to such an application.

P1group.Title: Responsible medical officers duty to apply for extension and variation of compulsion order

P2para.Text: If, having regard to

P3para.Text: any views expressed by persons consulted under section 139(3)(c) of this Act for the purpose of the review being carried out; and
any views expressed by the mental health officer under section 155(2)(e) of this Act for the purpose of that review,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer is satisfied as to the matters mentioned in section 154(2)(a) and (b) of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall comply with the requirement in subsection (2) below.
That requirement is to make an application to the Tribunal under section 158 of this Act for an order

P3para.Text: extending the compulsion order for the period mentioned in section 154(4) of this Act that applies in the patients case; and
varying that order by modifying the measures specified in it.

P1group.Title: Application for extension and variation of compulsion order: notification

P1para.Text: Where, by virtue of section 156(1) of this Act, an application is to be made under section 158 of this Act, the patients responsible medical officer shall, as soon as practicable after the duty to make the application arises (and, in any event, before making the application), give notice that the application is to be made to

P3para.Text: the patient;
the patients named person;
any guardian of the patient;
any welfare attorney of the patient;
the mental health officer; ...

P1group.Title: Application to Tribunal for extension and variation of compulsion order

P1para.Text: An application under this section to the Tribunal by a patients responsible medical officer for an order extending and varying a compulsion order

P3para.Text: shall state

P4para.Text: the name and address of the patient;
the name and address of the patients named person;
the modification of the measures authorised by the compulsion order that is proposed by the responsible medical officer;
the reasons for seeking that modification; ...
whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees, that the application should be made, or has failed to comply with the duty imposed by section 155(2)(e)(i) of this Act; and
if the mental health officer disagrees, the reason for that disagreement; and

P3para.Text: shall be accompanied by such documents as may be prescribed by regulations.

P1group.Title: Responsible medical officers duties: variation of compulsion order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patient is subject to a relevant compulsion order.

Without prejudice to the duties imposed on the patients responsible medical officer by sections 139(2), 140(2) and 145(2) of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall from time to time consider whether the compulsion order should be varied by modifying the measures specified in it.

If it appears to the responsible medical officer that the compulsion order should be varied by modifying the measures specified in it, the responsible medical officer shall, as soon as practicable, comply with the requirements in subsection (4) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: to assess the needs of the patient for medical treatment;
to consider what modification, if any, of the measures specified in the compulsion order is appropriate; and
to consult

P4para.Text: the mental health officer; and
such other persons as the responsible medical officer considers appropriate.

Text.Addition: If, having regard to any views expressed by persons consulted under subsection (4)(c) above, it continues to appear to the responsible medical officer that the compulsion order should be varied by modifying the measures specified in it, the responsible medical officer shall, as soon as practicable, notify the mental health officer
that the responsible medical officer is proposing to make an application to the Tribunal under section 161 of this Act for an order under section 167 of this Act varying the compulsion order; and
the modification of the measures specified in that order that the responsible medical officer is proposing.
The mental health officer shall, as soon as practicable after being notified under subsection (4A) above, comply with the requirements in subsection (4C) below.
Those requirements are
subject to subsection (4D) below, to interview the patient;
to inform the patient of the matters mentioned in subsection (4E) below;
to inform the patient of the availability of independent advocacy services under section 259 of this Act;
to take appropriate steps to ensure that the patient has the opportunity of making use of those services; and
to inform the patients responsible medical officer
of whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees, that the application that is proposed should be made;
if the mental health officer disagrees, of the reason why that is the case; and
of any other matters that the mental health officer considers relevant.
If it is impracticable for the mental health officer to comply with the requirement in subsection (4C)(a) above, the mental health officer need not do so.
The matters referred to in subsection (4C)(b) above are

that the patients responsible medical officer is proposing to make an application to the Tribunal under section 161 of this Act for an order varying the compulsion order by modifying the measures specified in it;
the modification of the measures specified in that order that the responsible medical officer is proposing; and
the patients rights in relation to such an application.

P2para.Text: If, having regard to any views expressed by persons consulted under subsection (4)(c) above, the responsible medical officer is satisfied that the compulsion order should be varied by modifying the measures specified in it, the responsible medical officer shall make an application to the Tribunal under section 161 of this Act for an order under section 167 of this Act varying the compulsion order in that way.

P1group.Title: Application for variation of compulsion order: notification

P1para.Text: Where, by virtue of section 159(5) of this Act, an application is to be made under section 161 of this Act, the patients responsible medical officer shall, as soon as practicable after the duty to make the application arises (and, in any event, before making the application), give notice that the application is to be made to the persons mentioned in section 157(a) to (e) of this Act.

P1group.Title: Application to Tribunal by responsible medical officer

P1para.Text: An application under this section to the Tribunal by a patients responsible medical officer for an order varying a compulsion order

P3para.Text: shall state

P4para.Text: the matters mentioned in section 158(a)(i) to (iv) of this Act; and

Text.Addition: whether the mental health officer agrees, or disagrees that the application should be made, or has failed to comply with the duty imposed by section 159(4C)(e)(i) of this Act; and
if the mental health officer disagrees, the reason for that disagreement.

P3para.Text: shall be accompanied by such documents as may be prescribed by regulations.

P1group.Title: Commissions power to make reference to Tribunal

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patient is subject to a relevant compulsion order.
If it appears to the Commission that it is appropriate to do so, it may make a reference to the Tribunal in respect of the compulsion order to which the patient is subject.
Where a reference is to be made under subsection (2) above, the Commission shall, as soon as practicable, give notice that a reference is to be made to

P3para.Text: the patients responsible medical officer; and
the persons mentioned in section 157(a) to (e) of this Act.

P2para.Text: A reference under subsection (2) above shall state

P3para.Text: the name and address of the patient;
the name and address of the patients named person; and
the reason for making the reference.

Title.Emphasis: Applications to Tribunal by patient etc.

P1group.Title: Application to Tribunal by patient etc. for revocation of determination extending compulsion order

P2para.Text: Subject to subsection (2) below, where a patients responsible medical officer makes a determination under section 152 of this Act

P3para.Text: the patient; or
the patients named person,

P2para.Text: may make an application under this section to the Tribunal for an order under section 167 of this Act revoking the determination.
Subsection (1) above does not apply where the Tribunal is required, by virtue of section 165 of this Act, to review the determination.

P1group.Title: Application to Tribunal by patient etc. for revocation or variation of compulsion order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patient is subject to a relevant compulsion order.
Either of the persons mentioned in subsection (3) below may, subject to subsections (4) to (6) below, make an application under this section to the Tribunal for an order under section 167 of this Act

P3para.Text: revoking the compulsion order; or
varying that order by modifying the measures specified in it.

P2para.Text: The persons referred to in subsection (2) above are

P3para.Text: the patient; and
the patients named person.

P2para.Text: An application under this section may not be made

P3para.Text: in respect of a compulsion order that has not been extended;
during the period of 3 months beginning with the making of

P4para.Text: an order in respect of the compulsion order made under section 166 of this Act; or
an order in respect of the compulsion order made, by virtue of section 149 or 158 of this Act, under section 167 of this Act.

P2para.Text: If

P3para.Text: an application under this section for revocation of a compulsion order is refused; or
an application is made under this section for variation of a compulsion order,

P2para.Text: the person who made the application shall not be entitled to make more than one further application under this section in respect of the compulsion order during the period mentioned in subsection (7) below.

If an application under section 163 of this Act for revocation of a determination under section 152 of this Act is refused, the person who made that application shall not be entitled to make more than one application under this section in respect of the compulsion order which is the subject of the determination during the period mentioned in subsection (7) below.
The period referred to in subsections (5) and (6) above is

P3para.Text: where the application is made during the period of 6 months beginning with the expiry of the initial period, that period of 6 months; or
any subsequent period of 12 months that begins with, or with an anniversary of, the expiry of the period of 6 months mentioned in paragraph (a) above.

P2para.Text: In subsection (7)(a) above, initial period means the period of 6 months beginning with the day on which the compulsion order is made.

Title.Addition: Application to end disclosure period for compulsion order

Text.Addition: This section applies where a patient is subject to a relevant compulsion order.

Either of the persons mentioned in subsection (3) may make an application under this section to the Tribunal for a determination under section 167A that the disclosure period applicable to the compulsion order is to come to an end.
The persons referred to in subsection (2) are
the patient, and
the patient's named person.
An application under this section may not be made until the expiry of the period of 12 months beginning with the day on which the order is made (or is deemed under section 198(2) to be made).

Where an application under this section relating to a compulsion order has already been refused by the Tribunal, a further such application relating to the order may not be made until the expiry of the period of 12 months beginning with the date of such refusal (or, where applicable, the date of the most recent such refusal).
An application under this section must be accompanied by such documents as may be prescribed by regulations.

Title.Emphasis: Review by Tribunal of determination extending order

P1group.Title: Tribunals duty to review determination under section 152

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer makes a determination under section 152 of this Act.
If

P3para.Text: the record submitted to the Tribunal under section 153 of this Act states

P4para.Text: that there is a difference between the type (or types) of mental disorder that the patient has and the type (or types) of mental disorder recorded in the compulsion order in respect of which the determination is made; or
that the mental health officer disagrees with the determination or has failed to comply with the duty imposed by section 151(2)(d)(i) of this Act; or

P3para.Text: no decision has been made by the Tribunal under this section or section 167 of this Act in respect of the compulsion order to which the determination relates during the period of 2 years ending with the day on which the order, had it not been extended by the determination, would have ceased to authorise the measures specified in it,

P2para.Text: the Tribunal shall review the determination.

P1group.Title: Powers of Tribunal on review under section 165

P2para.Text: On the review of a determination under section 165 of this Act, the Tribunal may make an order under this section

P3para.Text: revoking the determination;
revoking both the determination and the compulsion order;
confirming the determination; or
confirming the determination and varying the compulsion order by modifying the measures specified in it.

P2para.Text: Before making a decision under subsection (1) above, the Tribunal shall allow the persons mentioned in subsection (3) below the opportunity

P3para.Text: of making representations (whether orally or in writing); and
of leading, or producing, evidence.

P2para.Text: Those persons are

P3para.Text: the patient;
the patients named person;
any guardian of the patient;
any welfare attorney of the patient;
the mental health officer;
the patients responsible medical officer;
the patients primary carer;
any curator ad litem appointed in respect of the patient by the Tribunal; and
any other person appearing to the Tribunal to have an interest in the determination.

P1group.Title: Powers of Tribunal on application under section 149, 158, 161, 163 or 164

P2para.Text: Where an application is made under section 149 of this Act, the Tribunal may make an order

P3para.Text: extending the compulsion order to which the application relates for the period mentioned in section 146(2) of this Act;
refusing the application; or
refusing the application and revoking the compulsion order.

P2para.Text: Where an application is made under section 158 of this Act, the Tribunal may make an order

P3para.Text: extending the compulsion order to which the application relates for the period mentioned in section 154(4) of this Act and varying the compulsion order by modifying the measures specified in it;
extending the compulsion order for that period;
refusing the application; or
refusing the application and revoking the compulsion order.

P2para.Text: Where an application is made under section 163 of this Act, the Tribunal may make an order

P3para.Text: revoking the determination to which the application relates;
revoking

P4para.Text: the determination; and
the compulsion order to which the determination relates;

P3para.Text: confirming the determination; or
confirming the determination and varying the compulsion order by modifying the measures specified in it.

P2para.Text: Where an application is made under section 164(2)(a) of this Act, the Tribunal may make an order

P3para.Text: revoking the compulsion order to which the application relates;
varying the compulsion order by modifying the measures specified in it; or
refusing the application.

P2para.Text: Where an application is made under section 161 or 164(2)(b) of this Act, the Tribunal may make an order

P3para.Text: varying the compulsion order to which the application relates by modifying the measures specified in it;
refusing the application; or
refusing the application and revoking that order.

P2para.Text: Before making a decision under any of subsections (1) to (5) above, the Tribunal shall afford the persons mentioned in subsection (7) below the opportunity

P3para.Text: of making representations (whether orally or in writing); and
of leading, or producing, evidence.

P2para.Text: Those persons are

P3para.Text: the persons mentioned in section 166(3)(a) to (h) of this Act; and
any other person appearing to the Tribunal to have an interest in the application.

Title.Addition: Duties of Tribunal on application under section 164A

Text.Addition: This section applies where an application is made under section 164A in respect of a patient.

If the Tribunal is satisfied that, without the provision of medical treatment of the kind mentioned in section 139(4)(b) to the patient, there would be a significant risk to the safety of other persons, it must refuse the application.
If the Tribunal is not satisfied as mentioned in subsection (2), it must determine that the disclosure period applicable to the compulsion order ends with immediate effect.
Before refusing an application under subsection (2) or making a determination under subsection (3), the Tribunal must afford the persons mentioned in subsection (5) the opportunity
of making representations (whether orally or in writing), and
of leading, or producing, evidence.
Those persons are
the patient,
the patient's named person,
any guardian of the patient,
any welfare attorney of the patient,
the mental health officer,
the patient's responsible medical officer,
the patient's primary carer,
any curator ad litem appointed in respect of the patient by the Tribunal, and
any other person appearing to the Tribunal to have an interest in the application.
In this section and section 164A
, in relation to a compulsion order, is to be construed in accordance with the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974,
references to the disclosure period applicable to a compulsion order are to be construed in accordance with section 5G(1) of that Act.

Title.Addition: Duty to notify outcome of applications under section 164A

Text.Addition: The Scottish Ministers may require the Tribunal to provide the information mentioned in subsection (3) in respect of a person.

Where a requirement is made under subsection (1), the Tribunal must, before the expiry of the period of 15 working days beginning with the day on which the requirement is made, provide the Scottish Ministers with the information.

The information is whether a refusal under subsection (2) of section 167A has been given, or a determination under subsection (3) of that section has been made, in relation to the person to whom the request relates.
In subsection (2),
has the meaning given by section 47(8).

P1group.Title: Interim extension etc. of order: application under section 149or 158

P2para.Text: This section applies where an application is made under section 149or 158 of this Act.
Subject to section 170 of this Act, on the application of any person having an interest in the proceedings, or ex proprio motu, the Tribunal may, if it considers

P3para.Text: that it will be unable to determine the application before the compulsion order to which the application relates ceases to authorise the measures specified in it; and
that it is appropriate, pending its determining the application, to

P4para.Text: extend the order; or
extend and vary the order by modifying the measures specified in it,

P3para.Text: make an interim order extending, or extending and varying, the compulsion order for such period not exceeding 28 days as may be specified in the order of the Tribunal.

P1group.Title: Interim variation of order following application, reference or review under Chapter

P2para.Text: This section applies where

P3para.Text: an application is made under section 149, 158, 161, 163 or 164 of this Act;
a reference is made under section 162 of this Act; or
the Tribunal is reviewing a determination under section 165 of this Act.

P2para.Text: Subject to section 170 of this Act, on the application of any person having an interest in the proceedings, or ex proprio motu, the Tribunal may, if it considers that it is appropriate to do so pending its

P3para.Text: determining the application or reference; or
making its decision on the review,

P2para.Text: make an interim order varying the compulsion order by modifying the measures specified in it for such period not exceeding 28 days as may be specified in the order of the Tribunal.

P1group.Title: Limit on power of Tribunal to make interim order

P1para.Text: The Tribunal may not make an interim order under section 168 or 169 of this Act if the effect of making the order would be that interim orders under either, or both, of those sections would be in force for a continuous period of more than 56 days.

P1group.Title: Powers of Tribunal on reference under section 162

P2para.Text: Where a reference is made under section 162 of this Act, the Tribunal may make an order

P3para.Text: varying the compulsion order in respect of which the reference is made by modifying the measures specified in it; or
revoking the compulsion order.

P2para.Text: Before making an order under subsection (1) above, the Tribunal shall allow the persons mentioned in subsection (3) below the opportunity

P3para.Text: of making representations (whether orally or in writing); and
of leading, or producing, evidence.

P2para.Text: Those persons are

P3para.Text: the persons mentioned in section 166(3)(a) to (h) of this Act; and
any other person appearing to the Tribunal to have an interest in the reference.

P1group.Title: Tribunals order varying compulsion order

P1para.Text: ... where the Tribunal makes an order under section 166, 167 or 171 of this Act varying a compulsion order, the Tribunal

P3para.Text: shall specify in its order the modifications made by its order to the measures specified in the compulsion order; and
may specify in its order measures other than those set out in the application to which its order relates.

P1group.Title: Applications to Tribunal: ancillary powers

P2para.Text: This section applies where

P3para.Text: an application is made to the Tribunal under section 149, 158, 161, 163 or 164 of this Act; or
the Tribunal is, under section 165 of this Act, reviewing a determination.

P2para.Text: Regulations may prescribe circumstances in which the Tribunal may require

P3para.Text: the patients responsible medical officer; or
the mental health officer,

P2para.Text: to prepare and submit to the Tribunal reports on such matters as may be prescribed.

Title.Emphasis: Effect of interim orders: calculation of time periods in Chapter

P1group.Title: Effect of interim orders: calculation of time periods in Chapter

P2para.Text: Subject to subsection (2) below, in calculating, for the purpose of this Chapter of this Act, the day on which a relevant compulsion order

P3para.Text: ceases;
will cease; or
would have ceased,

P2para.Text: to authorise the measures specified in it, there shall be left out of account any period for which the order is extended (or extended and varied) by an interim order under section 168 of this Act.
Subsection (1) above does not apply as respects calculating that day for the purpose of that section.

P1group.Title: Meaning of modify

P1para.Text: In this Chapter any reference to modifying measures specified in a relevant compulsion order includes a reference to

P3para.Text: amending those measures;
removing from the order any measure;
adding to the order any measure.

Chapter.Title: Application of Chapters 5 to 7 of Part 7

P1group.Title: Medical treatment: failure to attend

P2para.Text: Section 112 of this Act shall apply in relation to a patient subject to a relevant compulsion order as that section applies in relation to a patient subject to a compulsory treatment order; but subject to the modifications in subsection (2) below.
Those modifications are

P3para.Text: in subsection (1)(a) of that section, the reference to section 66(1)(c) of this Act shall be read as a reference to section 57A(8)(c) of the 1995 Act; and
in subsection (4)(a) of that section, the reference to section 66(1)(b) of this Act shall be read as a reference to section 57A(8)(b) of the 1995 Act.

P1group.Title: Non-compliance generally with compulsion order

P2para.Text: Section 113 of this Act shall apply in relation to a patient subject to a relevant compulsion order as that section applies in relation to a patient subject to a compulsory treatment order.

Section 114 of this Act shall apply in relation to a patient subject to a relevant compulsion order as that section applies in relation to a patient subject to a compulsory treatment order; but subject to the modifications that references in that section to section 93(2) and (5) of this Act shall be read as references to section 159(2) and (5) of this Act respectively.

Sections 116, 117, 119, 120, 121 and 122 shall apply in relation to a certificate granted by virtue of subsection (2) above as those sections apply in relation to a certificate granted under section 114(2) of this Act; but subject to the modifications that

P3para.Text: any references in those sections to section 93(2) of this Act shall be read as references to section 159(2) of this Act; and
any references to section 66(1)(b) of this Act shall be read as references to section 57A(8)(b) of the 1995 Act.

P1group.Title: Transfers

P1para.Text: Sections 124 to 126 of this Act shall apply in relation to a patient whose detention in hospital is authorised by a relevant compulsion order as those sections apply in relation to a patient whose detention in hospital is authorised by a compulsory treatment order.

P1group.Title: Suspension of measures

P2para.Text: Section 127 of this Act shall apply in relation to a patient subject to a relevant compulsion order as that section applies in relation to a patient subject to a compulsory treatment order; but subject to the modification that references in that section to section 66(1)(a) of this Act shall be read as references to section 57A(8)(a) of the 1995 Actand to section 105 or 106 shall be read as references to section 168 or 169 of this Act.

Section 128 of this Act shall apply in relation to a patient subject to a relevant compulsion order as that section applies in relation to a patient subject to a compulsory treatment order; but subject to the modification that references in that section to section 66(1)(b) to (h) of this Act shall be read as references to section 57A(8)(b) to (h) of the 1995 Act.
Section 129 of this Act shall apply in relation to a patient subject to a relevant compulsion order as that section applies in relation to a patient subject to a compulsory treatment order.

P1group.Title: Interpretation of Part

P1para.Text: In this Part of this Act relevant compulsion order has the meaning given by section 137(1) of this Act.

P1group.Title: Mental health officers duty to identify named person

P2para.Text: This section applies where a compulsion order and a restriction order are made in respect of a patient.

The mental health officer shall, as soon as practicable after the compulsion order is made, take such steps as are reasonably practicable to ascertain the name and address of the patients named person.

P1group.Title: Review of compulsion order and restriction order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patient is subject to a compulsion order and a restriction order.

The patients responsible medical officer shall, during the period of 2 months ending with the relevant day, carry out a review in respect of both the compulsion order and restriction order by complying with the requirements set out in subsection (3) below.
Those requirements are

P3para.Text: to

P4para.Text: carry out a medical examination of the patient; or
make arrangements for an approved medical practitioner to carry out such a medical examination;

P3para.Text: to consider

P4para.Text: whether the conditions mentioned in subsection (4) below continue to apply in respect of the patient;

whether, as a result of the patients mental disorder, it is necessary, in order to protect any other person from serious harm, for the patient to be detained in hospital, whether or not for medical treatment;
whether it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order; and
whether it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the restriction order; and

P3para.Text: to consult the mental health officer.

P2para.Text: Those conditions are

P3para.Text: that the patient has a mental disorder;
that medical treatment which would be likely to

P4para.Text: prevent the mental disorder worsening; or
alleviate any of the symptoms, or effects, of the disorder,

P3para.Text: is available for the patient; and
that if the patient were not provided with such medical treatment there would be a significant risk

P4para.Text: to the health, safety or welfare of the patient; or
to the safety of any other person.

P2para.Text: In subsection (2) above, the relevant day means

P3para.Text: the day which falls 12 months after the day on which the compulsion order is made; or
where that relevant day has passed, the day falling on the same day in every year thereafter.

P1group.Title: Responsible medical officers report and recommendation following review of compulsion order and restriction order

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patients responsible medical officer carries out a review under section 182(2) of this Act.
The responsible medical officer shall, as soon as practicable after carrying out that review, submit a report in accordance with subsection (3) below to the Scottish Ministers.
That report shall record the responsible medical officers views as to

P3para.Text: whether the conditions mentioned in section 182(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient;

whether, as a result of the patients mental disorder, it is necessary, in order to protect any other person from serious harm, for the patient to be detained in hospital, whether or not for medical treatment;
whether it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order; and
whether it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the restriction order.

P2para.Text: If, after having regard to any views expressed by the mental health officer, the responsible medical officer is not satisfied that the patient has a mental disorder, the responsible medical officer shall include in the report submitted to the Scottish Ministers under subsection (2) above a recommendation that the compulsion order be revoked.
If, after having regard to any views expressed by the mental health officer, the responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: is satisfied that the patient has a mental disorder; but
is not satisfied

P4para.Text: that, as a result of the patients mental disorder, it is necessary, in order to protect any other person from serious harm, for the patient to be detained in hospital, whether or not for medical treatment; and

Text.Substitution: either
that the conditions mentioned in paragraphs (b) and (c) of section 182(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; or
that it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order,

P3para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall include in the report submitted under subsection (2) above a recommendation that the compulsion order be revoked.

P2para.Text: If, after having regard to any views expressed by the mental health officer, the responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: is satisfied

P4para.Text: that the conditions mentioned in section 182(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; and
that it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order; but

P3para.Text: is not satisfied

P4para.Text: that, as a result of the patients mental disorder, it is necessary, in order to protect any other person from serious harm, for the patient to be detained in hospital, whether or not for medical treatment; and
that it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the restriction order,

P3para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall include in the report submitted to the Scottish Ministers under subsection (2) above a recommendation that the restriction order be revoked.

P2para.Text: If, after having regard to any views expressed by the mental health officer, the responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: is satisfied

P4para.Text: that the conditions mentioned in section 182(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient; and
that it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order and the restriction order; but

P3para.Text: is not satisfied that, as a result of the patients mental disorder, it is necessary, in order to protect any other person from serious harm, for the patient to be detained in hospital, whether or not for medical treatment,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer may include in the report submitted to the Scottish Ministers under subsection (2) above a recommendation that the patient be conditionally discharged.
Where the responsible medical officer

P3para.Text: submits a report under subsection (2) above that includes a recommendation under subsection (6) above; and
is satisfied that the compulsion order should be varied by modifying the measures specified in it,

P2para.Text: the responsible medical officer shall include in the report a recommendation that the compulsion order be varied in that way.

Title.Emphasis: Responsible medical officers duty to keep orders under review

P1group.Title: Responsible medical officers duty to keep compulsion order and restriction order under review

P2para.Text: This section applies where a patient is subject to a compulsion order and a restriction order.
Without prejudice to the duty imposed on the patients responsible medical officer by section 182(2) of this Act, the responsible medical officer shall from time to time consider

P3para.Text: whether the conditions mentioned in section 182(4) of this Act continue to apply in respect of the patient;

whether, as a result of the patients mental disorder, it is necessary, in order to protect any other person from serious harm, for the patient to be detained in hospital, whether or not for medical treatment;
whether it continues to be necessary for the patient to be subject to the compulsion order; and
